Class Terminal

  • java.lang.Object
    • Terminal

  • public class Terminal
extends java.lang.Object
    An alternative Terminal class that additionally provides possibilities for automatic testing. All methods of the original Terminal class and many additional testing methods are implemented. All tests should be invoked by separate testing classes. (Note: when used for testing the usual functionality is disabled.)

    Every test must start with calling Terminal.initTestSession(Runnable main). Afterwards various testing methods can be called: nextInput(String input) and nextOutput() provide the basic input/output functionality. The assert and test methods compare the real and expected output of the tested program. For example, assertOutput(String expected) will effectively invoke nextOutput() and compare the result to the expected parameter. The difference between assert and test is, that test methods additionally invoke nextInput() with a given input String, so that giving input and testing output is combined in one method. Apart from testing output, it is possible to test whether the program terminates or whether a specified exception occurs.

    The behavior of the tests can be specified by so called policies. Dependent on the printPolicy the input and output and/or failure messages will be printed to System.out, or not. The cancelPolicy determines whether the tests will be canceled or continued at failures. And setTimeOut(long millis) specifies how long the test will wait for answers.

    By enforceExit() the termination of the tested program can be enforced. For this method and canceling working properly, the tested program must not catch general RuntimeExceptions (or a supertype) thrown by readLine() or a print method. An additional utility is provided by runCancelingTest(Runnable test), which enables to run a test method, that will be canceled at failures, without canceling the entire test.

    Code Example: 

     
 import static terminal.Terminal.*;

 public class StudyPortalTest {
      public static void basicTest() {
              initTestSession(() -> StudyPortal.main(new String[0]));
              testOutput("add-student max;mustermann;123456", "Ok");
              testOutput("add-student albert;albertus;654321", "Ok");

              nextInput("list-student");
              assertOutput("123456 max mustermann none");
              assertOutput("654321 albert albertus none");

              // alternatively:
              testList("list-student", "123456 max mustermann none", "654321 albert albertus none");

              testPrefix("add-lecture la", "Error, ");
              testPrefix("Identical matriculation numbers are not permitted.",
                      "add-student maximilia;mustermann;123456", "Error, ");

              if (!testExit("quit")) {
                      // not really necessary, as starting a new test will terminate the preceding one
                      enforceExit();
              }
      }

      public static void main(String[] args) {
              setPrintPolicy(PRINT_IN_OUT);
              runCancelingTest(() -> basicTest(), "Basic test canceled.");
      }
 }

    • Method Detail

      • setPrintPolicy

        public static void setPrintPolicy(int policy)
        This policy determines what will be print through System.out. Parameters must be element of Terminal.{PRINT_NONE, PRINT_IN_OUT, PRINT_FAILURES, PRINT_ALL}. For details see the documentation of the constants.

        Default value: PRINT_ALL

        Parameters:
        policy - the printPolicy to be set
        See Also:
        PRINT_NONE

      • setCancelPolicy

        public static void setCancelPolicy(int policy)
        This policy determines whether the test will be canceled after failures. For canceling, the testing method will throw a Terminal.CancelException.

        It is considered a difference between usual failures (meaning that expected and received value of output differs; "FAILURE" message) and mismatches (meaning that expected and received order of input/output differs; "MISMATCH" message). So the CANCEL_AT_MISMATCHES policy will cancel tests at mismatches, but not at usual failures.

        Default value: CANCEL_NEVER

        Parameters:
        policy - whether the test will be canceled at failures
        See Also:
        CANCEL_NEVER

      • setTimeOut

        public static void setTimeOut(long millis)
        This method determines mainly, how long the test will wait for responses of the tested program. The default value should work well for most purposes. Increase the value if expecting very time-expensive calculations, decrease the value for making the test fail more quickly (and so needing less time).

        More specific, the method additionally determines that vice versa the tested program will wait the double amount of time for input or acceptance of output (which value is generally of less importance).

        Default value: 100

        Parameters:
        millis - the number of milliseconds the test will wait for responses

      • initTestSession

        public static void initTestSession(Runnable main)
        Starts a test session. A previous test that is still running will be terminated. For specifying what to test, a Runnable is required as parameter, that invokes the (probably main-) method to be tested.

        Example: 

         Terminal.initTestSession(() -> TestedClass.main(new String[0]));
        Parameters:
        main - Runnable, invoking the method to be tested

      • runCancelingTest

        public static void runCancelingTest(Runnable test)
        Utility method for running a test that should be canceled. Using this method prevents an uncaught exception and will cancel only the single test instead of the entire test routine.

        While running the testing method, the cancelPolicy will be changed to CANCEL_ALWAYS, and reset to the preceding value afterwards.

        Example: 

         Terminal.runCancelingTest(() -> testMethod());
        Parameters:
        test - the test method to be run

      • runCancelingTest

        public static void runCancelingTest(Runnable test,
                                    boolean cancelAtFailure)
        Utility method for running a test that should be canceled. Using this method prevents an uncaught exception and will cancel only the single test instead of the entire test routine.

        While running the testing method, the cancelPolicy will (depending on the cancelAtFailure parameter) be changed to CANCEL_ALWAYS or CANCEL_AT_MISMATCH, and reset to the preceding value afterwards.

        Parameters:
        test - the test method to be run
        cancelAtFailure - if false, cancels only at mismatches (default: true)
        See Also:
        runCancelingTest(Runnable)

      • runCancelingTest

        public static void runCancelingTest(Runnable test,
                                    String message)
        Utility method for running a test that should be canceled. Using this method prevents an uncaught exception and will cancel only the single test instead of the entire test routine.

        While running the testing method, the cancelPolicy will be changed to CANCEL_ALWAYS, and reset to the preceding value afterwards. If the test cancels, the message will be printed.

        Parameters:
        test - the test method to be run
        message - printed if the test cancels
        See Also:
        runCancelingTest(Runnable)

      • runCancelingTest

        public static void runCancelingTest(Runnable test,
                                    String message,
                                    boolean cancelAtFailure)
        Utility method for running a test that should be canceled. Using this method prevents an uncaught exception and will cancel only the single test instead of the entire test routine.

        While running the testing method, the cancelPolicy will (depending on the cancelAtFailure parameter) be changed to CANCEL_ALWAYS or CANCEL_AT_MISMATCH, and reset to the preceding value afterwards. If the test cancels, the message will be printed.

        Parameters:
        test - the test method to be run
        message - printed if the test cancels
        cancelAtFailure - if false, cancels only at mismatches (default: true)
        See Also:
        runCancelingTest(Runnable)

      • nextInput

        public static void nextInput(String input)
        Defines the input the tested program will receive by the next call to Terminal.readLine().

        The method will block at maximum as long as defined by Terminal.setTimeOut(long millis).

        Parameters:
        input - the input for the Terminal
        Throws:
        Terminal.CancelException - if the tested program currently accepts no input and the cancel policy requests a cancel for mismatches

      • nextOutput

        public static String nextOutput()
        Returns the next output printed by the tested program.

        The method will block at maximum as long as defined by Terminal.setTimeOut(long millis).

        Returns:
        output received by Terminal.printLine()
        Throws:
        Terminal.CancelException - if the tested program currently offers no output and the cancel policy requests a cancel for mismatches

      • assertOutput

        public static boolean assertOutput(String expected)
        Tests, whether the next output is equal to the expected output.
        Parameters:
        expected - the String the output is compared to
        Returns:
        true, if nextOutput().equals(expected)
        Throws:
        Terminal.CancelException - if the test fails and the cancel policy requests a cancel

      • assertOutput

                                   String expected)

        Parameters:
        message - printed if the test fails and the printPolicy permits it
        expected - the String the output is compared to
        Returns:
        true, if nextOutput().equals(expected)
        Throws:
        Terminal.CancelException - if the test fails and the cancel policy requests a cancel

        expected - the String the output is compared to

        Returns:
        true, if nextOutput().startsWith(expected)

      • assertList

        public static boolean assertList(String... expected)
        Tests, whether the next outputs match the expected outputs.
        Parameters:
        expected - the list of Strings the output is compared to
        Returns:
        true, if nextOutput() matches with each String in expected
        Throws:
        Terminal.CancelException - if the test fails and the cancel policy requests a cancel

      • assertList

        public static boolean assertList(boolean prefix,
                                 boolean randomOrder,
                                 String... expected)
        Tests, whether the next outputs match the expected outputs.
        Parameters:
        prefix - if true, only the prefix will be compared (default: false)
        randomOrder - if true, any possible order of the output will be accepted (default: false)
        expected - the list of Strings the output is compared to
        Returns:
        true, if nextOutput() matches with each String in expected
        Throws:
        Terminal.CancelException - if the test fails and the cancel policy requests a cancel

      • assertException

        public static <T extends Throwable> boolean assertException(Class<T> eType)
        Tests whether the specified type of Exception (or, more generally, Throwable) occurs. For this, the class of the Exception is required as parameter.

        Example: 

         Terminal.assertException(IllegalArgumentException.class);
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the expected Expression
        Parameters:
        eType - the class (or a superclass) of the expected Exception
        Returns:
        true, if the expected Exception occured
        Throws:
        Terminal.CancelException - if the test fails and the cancel policy requests a cancel

      • enforceExit

        public static void enforceExit()
        Terminates the test (more or less) immediately. For this method working properly, the tested program must not catch RuntimeExceptions (or a supertype) thrown by readLine() or a print method.

        Precisely, the tested program will be terminated as soon as it invokes any Terminal method. The method itself returns without delay.

      • printError

        public static void printError(String message)
        Prints the given error-message with the prefix "Error, ".

        More specific, this method behaves exactly as if the following code got executed: 

         Terminal.printLine("Error, " + message);
        Parameters:
        message - the error message to be printed
        See Also:
        printLine(Object)

      • printLine

        public static void printLine(Object object)
        Prints the string representation of an Object and then terminates the line.

        If the argument is null, then the string "null" is printed, otherwise the object's string value obj.toString() is printed.

        Parameters:
        object - the Object to be printed
        See Also:
        String.valueOf(Object)

      • printLine

        public static void printLine(char[] charArray)
        Prints an array of characters and then terminates the line.

        If the argument is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown, otherwise the value of new String(charArray) is printed.

        Parameters:
        charArray - an array of chars to be printed
        See Also:
        String.valueOf(char[])

      • readLine

        public static String readLine()
        Reads a line of text. A line is considered to be terminated by any one of a line feed ('\n'), a carriage return ('\r'), or a carriage return followed immediately by a linefeed.
        Returns:
        a String containing the contents of the line, not including any line-termination characters, or null if the end of the stream has been reached

      • readFile

        public static String[] readFile(String path)
        Reads the file with the specified path and returns its content stored in a String array. Whereas the first array field contains the file's first line, the second field contains the second line, and so on.

        Not supported for testing yet.

        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file to be read
        Returns:
        the content of the file stored in a String array
